title: Donald Trump called 'grotesque' for comparing himself to racist lynching victims
text:
Donald Trump sparked fury after comparing himself to black victims of racist lynchings (Picture: Rex)

Donald Trump was branded ‘grotesque’ for comparing an investigation into his alleged misconduct to racist lynchings meted out to black Americans.

The President of the United States hit out at the lower house of the US Congress – the House of Representatives – plans to hold a formal investigation, or impeachment, after Trump suggested the Ukrainian government investigate rival Joe Biden’s son.

He tweeted: ‘So some day, if a Democrat becomes President and the Republicans win the House, even by a tiny margin, they can impeach the President, without due process or fairness or any legal rights.

‘All Republicans must remember what they are witnessing here — a lynching. But we will WIN!’

Lynchings, or hangings, historically were mostly used by whites against black men, mostly in the South, beginning in the late 19th century amid rising racial tensions in the US.

Donald Trump has sparked outrage after comparing his treatment at the hands of Democrats to ‘lynching’, with critics calling on him to delete the tweet

By comparing his possible impeachment to a lynching, Trump is also likening Democrats to a lynch mob.

Former Florida Governor Jeb Bush, whose dad George HW and brother George W both served as president, was among those condemning the comment.

He tweeted: ‘The president is not a victim. He should be the most powerful person on the planet.

‘To equate his plight to lynching is grotesque.’

And the highest-ranking African American in Congress, House Majority Whip Representative Jim Clyburn, was among those who criticized President Trump for making the comparison.

Clyburn, a South Carolina Democrat told CNN: ‘That is one word no president ought to apply to himself.

‘That is a word that we ought to be very, very careful about using.’

Illinois Representative Bobby Rush also called on Trump to remove the tweet.

He said: ‘Do you know how many people who look like me have been lynched, since the inception of this country, by people who look like you.

‘Delete this tweet.’

Trump has lashed out after the House of Representatives – also known as the House – pushed for an impeachment hearing over a July phone chat with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy.

The House is controlled by a Democrat majority, with the upper house – the US Senate – filled mainly by members of Trump’s Republican party.

It is those senators who ultimately vote on whether the evidence presented against Trump is sufficient for him to be removed from office.

Over the weekend, President Trump was forced to abandon plans to host next year’s G-7 summit of world leaders at his Trump Doral Resort near Miami.

He has also been widely condemned for pulling US troops out of Northern Syria and leaving Kurdish allies at the mercy of hostile Turkish forces.
